form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Collins introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

form.official-title: To provide authority for certain depository institutions, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Community Bank Sensible Regulation Act of 2015.

section.header: Exemptive authority for the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation
section.text: Section 10 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act (12 U.S.C. 1820) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Corporation, after considering the factors in paragraph (3), may exempt by rule any depository institution having less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets from—

subparagraph.text: any provision of this Act;
any rule promulgated under this Act; or
any rule promulgated under any other Act conferring authority to the Corporation.

paragraph.text: The Corporation may impose conditions on an exemption granted under paragraph (1).
In issuing an exemption under paragraph (1), the Corporation shall consider, as appropriate, the extent to which—

subparagraph.text: the provision or rule would impose an unnecessary or undue burden or cost on the depository institution;
the provision or rule is unnecessary or unwarranted in order to promote the safety and soundness of the depository institution; and
the exemption is necessary, appropriate, or consistent with the public interest.

paragraph.text: The asset threshold identified in paragraph (1) shall be increased annually at a percentage equal to the percentage change in the total aggregate assets of insured depository institutions for each 12-month period ending in December of each year, rounded to the nearest $10,000,000.

section.header: Exemptive authority for the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency

subsection.text: Section 5239A of the Revised Statutes is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking Except and inserting the following:
by adding at the end the following:
In this subsection, the term insured depository institution has the meaning given the term in section 3 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act (12 U.S.C. 1813).

Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Comptroller of the Currency, after considering the factors in paragraph (4), may exempt by rule any national bank having less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets from—

subparagraph.text: any provision of this title;
any rule promulgated under this title; or
any rule promulgated under any other title or Act that confers authority to the Comptroller.

paragraph.text: The Comptroller may impose conditions on an exemption granted under paragraph (2).
In issuing an exemption under paragraph (2), the Comptroller shall consider, as appropriate, the extent to which—

subparagraph.text: the provision or rule would impose an unnecessary or undue burden or cost on the national bank;
the provision or rule is unnecessary or unwarranted to promote the safety and soundness of the national bank; and
the exemption is necessary, appropriate, or consistent with the public interest.

paragraph.text: The asset threshold identified in paragraph (1) shall be increased annually at a percentage equal to the percentage change in the total aggregate assets of insured depository institutions for each 12-month period ending in December of each year, rounded to the nearest $10,000,000.

subsection.text: Section 4(a) of the Home Owners’ Loan Act (12 U.S.C. 1463(a)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: In this paragraph, the term insured depository institution has the meaning given the term in section 3 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act (12 U.S.C. 1813).

Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Comptroller of the Currency, after considering the factors in subparagraph (D), may exempt by rule any savings association having less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets from—

clause.text: any rule promulgated under this title; or
any rule promulgated under any other title or Act conferring authority on the Comptroller.

In issuing an exemption under subparagraph (B), the Comptroller shall consider, as appropriate, the extent to which—

In this section, the term insured depository institution has the meaning given the term in section 3 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act (12 U.S.C. 1813).

Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Board, after considering the factors in subsection (d), may exempt by rule any bank holding company having less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets from—

subsection.header: Exemptive authority for savings and loan holding companies and mutual holding companies
subsection.text: Section 10 of the Home Owners’ Loan Act (12 U.S.C. 1467a) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: In this subsection—

subparagraph.text: the term insured depository institution has the meaning given the term in section 3 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act (12 U.S.C. 1813); and
the term mutual holding company has the meaning given the term in subsection (o)(10)(A).

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Board, after considering the factors in paragraph (4), may exempt by rule any savings and loan holding company or any mutual holding company having less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets from—

subparagraph.text: any provision of this Act;
any rule promulgated under this Act; or
any rule promulgated under any other Act conferring authority on the Board.

paragraph.text: The Board may impose conditions on an exemption granted under paragraph (2).
In issuing an exemption under paragraph (2), the Board shall consider the extent to which—

subparagraph.text: the provision or rule would impose an unnecessary or undue burden or cost on the savings and loan holding company or the mutual holding company;
the provision or rule is unnecessary or unwarranted to promote the safety and soundness of the savings and loan holding company or the mutual holding company; and
the exemption is necessary, appropriate, or consistent with the public interest.

paragraph.text: The authority granted under paragraph (2) shall not apply with respect to a savings and loan holding company described in subsection (c)(9)(C).

The asset threshold identified in paragraph (2) shall be increased annually at a percentage equal to the percentage change in the total aggregate assets of insured depository institutions for each 12-month period ending in December of each year, rounded to the nearest $10,000,000.
